t: The*p word of the Lord*s that came to Jeremiah the prophet concerning the Philistines, before Pharaoh struck down Gaza.

“Thus*pn says the Lord:*s Behold,*ln waters are rising out of the north, and*ld shall become an overflowing torrent; they*ln shall overflow the land and all that fills it, the*ld city and those who dwell in it. Men*ln shall cry out, and*ld every inhabitant of the land shall wail.

At*ln the noise of the stamping of the hoofs of his stallions, at*ld the rushing of his chariots, at the rumbling of their wheels, the*ln fathers look not back to their children, so*ld feeble are their hands,

because*ln of the day that is coming to destroy all*ld the Philistines, to*ln cut off from Tyre and Sidon every*ld helper that remains. For*ln the Lord*s is destroying the Philistines, the*ld remnant of the coastland of Caphtor.
Baldness*ln has come upon Gaza; Ashkelon*ld has perished. O*ln remnant of their valley, how*ld long will you gash yourselves?
Ah,*ln sword of the Lord!*s How*ld long till you are quiet? Put*ln yourself into your scabbard; rest*ld and be still!
How*ln can it be quiet when*ld the Lord*s has given it a charge? Against*ln Ashkelon and against the seashore he*ld has appointed it.”
